Text: The speaker sounds a bit better than the past generation, and the sounds are noticeably clearer (or less muddy). Although I like both the old and new designs, I personally like this a bit more. It feels surprisingly high quality in the hand and is the obviously better deal when compared with a HomePod mini's price-to-performance ratio. I am a big fan of this Echo Dot generation's aesthetics. To me, it looks and feels premium--like a tech product I would leave purposely visible as part of my area, opposed to one I would manage hidden under my desk, behind a lamp, etc. My favorite new feature is the inclusion of a tap-to-play/pause function, and my biggest complaint is the lack of further music/media integration on the Alexa mobile app (as trying to play or queue up specific songs/playlists from Apple Music can be frustrating).Overall, you can't go wrong with this speaker for the price (and functionality it offers), especially when pairing two for a stereo pair.
Location/Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2024

Text: So this black device came with a white cord. Was not expecting that at all. All my previous Echo devices came with a black cord. Seems like not the end of the world. I have a tower power strip that is pretty full. Sits on floor. The other black cords in there don't really show. Kind of blend in with the shadows near the floor. This one looks terrible and the white sticks out like a sore thumb and a beacon in the night. Looks really messy and tacky. I honestly would not have purchased this device if I had known it had a black cord. Never seen a white cord from Amazon. I should have looked at the pics more thoroughly perhaps. Given my past experience it never crossed my mind. Sorry I bought it and not going to use it. How does it work? I don't know. Not using it and leaving my old Echo thing there.

Text: The Amazon Echo Dot is the perfect addition to any home, combining a compact design with impressive sound quality and Alexa‚Äôs endless capabilities. Whether it‚Äôs for music, smart home control, or quick voice commands, this little speaker delivers big results.The sound is surprisingly vibrant and clear for such a small speaker. The bass is punchy, vocals are crisp, and it easily fills a bedroom, dining room, or small living space. It‚Äôs perfect for streaming playlists, podcasts, or even ambient sounds for relaxation.Alexa works flawlessly with this device. From controlling my smart lights and thermostat to setting timers, alarms, and reminders, the Echo Dot has quickly become part of my daily routine. It‚Äôs also great for quick weather updates, news, and fun trivia with Alexa‚Äôs skills.The sleek, modern design fits beautifully in any room. It‚Äôs compact enough to sit on a nightstand, kitchen counter, or shelf without taking up much space. The built-in LED display on some models is a bonus for showing the time or alarms.It seamlessly connects to other smart home devices, making it a hub for my smart lights, plugs, and speakers. Multi-room audio is a game-changer when paired with other Echo devices ‚Äì I can play music throughout the house with a simple voice command.
Location/Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2024

Text: I don't get what all the hype is for this thing.  My 10 yo bought the Echo with his own money and it's a pile of junk.  We can only get Pandora to work. Text: Just not that great. I traded my old Echo Dots (small pucks) for this and 2 Echo Pops.So here we go....It comes with it's own LARGE WHITE plug almost 3 inches big. No more USB which makes it difficult to place- I have USB outlets to save space.The Dot itself is big and awkward. It doesn't fit into places easily. Older Dots could be mounted on the wall, under cabinets, and on the sides of a nightstand and still operate. These larger Dots just take up space and don't hide well, especially with the bright white cord and fat plug.It lights up the same as all Alexa stuff. Nothing new or fantastic.It seems to mis-hear a lot. More than older Dots.I can't go over Sound Quality because I only use this Echo Dot for light control and rarely Spotify. Since I moved houses it's just a voice controlled light switch. I used my older Echo Dots for motion sensors, lights, alarms door locks, sequences before moving.If you are looking to "upgrade" I'd just hold onto older Dots.It's not a status symbol to show off an Echo Dot. I don't want it sitting out on my counters, shelves, nightstands etc.
Location/Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024

Text: I bought the Echo Dot hoping it would make a decent white noise machine and I was deeply mistaken. I on random occasions can get the Dot to play 'rain sounds' properly but most of the time I was met with a long monologue informing me I could pay a fee for white noise if I wished. Any effort to decline the subscription or try to get the Dot to just play the free version of white noise was met with silence.I tried to research how to fix the issue and most people online said to request 'Sleep Sounds'. My Dot recognized this command and would even say 'playing sleep sounds now' but nothing would play. Also, in the instances where I was able to get rain sounds to play it doesn't loop, it will abruptly stop without you asking and you'll have to pull teeth in order to get the white noise back.I don't have other Amazon home products so I wanted this for the white noise and the alarm clock. So, right now it's just a glorified alarm clock.
Location/Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024
